title: [BUG] Web app throws native libSkiaSharp library version exception in hosted environment
body:
### Description

While running web app in hosted environment, the application throws a runtime exception due to an incompatible native library.
I am encountering an issue after deploying my web application to Azure App Service (Linux). The application works perfectly in my local development environment (Windows, Visual Studio), but on Linux, I’m seeing the following runtime error in the browser console:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9624c2c7-42fa-454a-a838-c8ab6f4db6ee)

**Project Structure**
I have three related projects:

Dashboard (XAF project with DevExpress components)

Core (shared class library used by Dashboard, Worker)

Worker (background service, also dependent on Core)

The Worker project is working fine in the same environment (App Service on Linux with Docker).
The issue only occurs in the Dashboard project when hosted on Linux, while it works correctly on Windows.

 **Dependencies**
Below are the relevant package references from each project:

```
**Dashboard Project:**

<PackageReference Include="DevExpress.Blazor" Version="24.2.6" />
<PackageReference Include="DevExpress.Drawing.Skia" Version="24.2.6" />

**Core Project**

<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="3.119.0" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies" Version="3.119.0" />

**Worker Project**
<ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Hangfire.Console" Version="1.4.3" />
    <PackageReference Include="Hangfire" Version="1.8.18" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi" Version="8.0.15"/>
    <PackageReference Include="Swashbuckle.AspNetCore" Version="8.1.1" />
</ItemGroup>

<ItemGroup>
  <ProjectReference Include="..\Core\Core.csproj" />
</ItemGroup>

```
Is DevExpress.Drawing.Skia internally dependent on a different version of SkiaSharp or does it override anything that may conflict with our version?

The same configuration works on Windows, but not on Linux.

The Worker project proves that SkiaSharp works in the same Linux environment, so the issue seems specific to how DevExpress components behave with SkiaSharp or system dependencies on Linux.
Please advise if there are known compatibility issues or any recommended steps for resolving this issue when running DevExpress.Drawing.Skia and SkiaSharp on Linux App Services.
Your help is greatly appreciated.

### Code


**Dashboard Project:**

<PackageReference Include="DevExpress.Blazor" Version="24.2.6" />
<PackageReference Include="DevExpress.Drawing.Skia" Version="24.2.6" />

**Core Project**

<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="3.119.0" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies" Version="3.119.0" />

**Worker Project**
<ItemGroup>

    <PackageReference Include="Hangfire" Version="1.8.18" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi" Version="8.0.15"/>
    <PackageReference Include="Swashbuckle.AspNetCore" Version="8.1.1" />
</ItemGroup>

<ItemGroup>
  <ProjectReference Include="..\Core\Core.csproj" />
</ItemGroup>

### Expected Behavior

WEb app should run smoothly when hosted

### Actual Behavior

Error
